definition: to root out the strong and support the weak (idiom); to rob the rich and give to the poor
a hoe/to hoe or dig/to weed/to get rid of
strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort
to support with the hand/to help sb up/to support oneself by holding onto something/to help
weak/feeble/young/inferior/(following a decimal or fraction) slightly less than

sentences.english: The reflection of the property on novel is to eliminate the bullies and help the down-trodden chivalrously.
sentences.chinese: 這種性質在小說上的反映就是行俠仗義和鋤強扶弱。

sentences.english: They traveled the world, rescued orphans, curbed the violent and assisted the weak.
sentences.chinese: 二人遊歷人間，救助孤寡，鋤強扶弱。
